Ergo Proxy.label: Ergo Proxy
Ergo Proxy.description: Ergo Proxy is a science fiction suspense anime television series, produced by Manglobe, which premiered across Japan on 25 February 2006 on the WOWOW satellite network. It is directed by Shukō Murase, with screenplay by Dai Satō et al.. Wikipedia

Adventures of the Little Koala.label: Adventures of the Little Koala
Adventures of the Little Koala.description: Adventures of the Little Koala is an anime TV series produced by Tohokushinsha Film Corporation. It aired originally in Japan on TV Tokyo from October 4, 1984 through March 28, 1985, and then aired in ... Wikipedia

Samurai Pizza Cats.label: Samurai Pizza Cats
Samurai Pizza Cats.description: Samurai Pizza Cats is a cartoon series produced by Saban as an English adaption of the anime series Kyatto Ninden Teyandee, produced by Tatsunoko Productions and Sotsu Agency. Wikipedia

Lighthouse Mouse.label: Lighthouse Mouse
Lighthouse Mouse.description: Lighthouse Mouse is a Warner Brothers Merrie Melodies animated cartoon featuring Sylvester the Cat, Hippety Hopper, a lightkeeper who speaks with a pronounced Scottish brogue, a loquacious parrot named ... Wikipedia

Sherlock Hound.label: Meitantei Holmes
Sherlock Hound.description: Sherlock Hound is an anime television series based on Sir Arthur Conan Doyle's Sherlock Holmes series where almost all the characters are depicted as anthropomorphic dogs. Wikipedia

The Adventures of Hutch the Honeybee.label: The Adventures of Hutch the Honeybee
The Adventures of Hutch the Honeybee.description: The Adventures of Hutch the Honeybee, or Honeybee Hutch, is an anime cartoon series produced by Tatsunoko Productions. Wikipedia

Witch Hunter Robin.label: Witch Hunter Robin
Witch Hunter Robin.description: Witch Hunter Robin is a Japanese anime series created by Sunrise. It follows the STN-J, the Japanese branch of a secret global organization called "SOLOMON" or the "Solomon Toukatsu Nin'idantai", abbreviated as "STN". Wikipedia

Wowser (TV series).label: Wowser
Wowser (TV series).description: Wowser is an anime based on the Belgian comic strip Cubitus. It consisted of 52 two-part episodes, and originally aired from 5 April 1988 to 27 March 1989. Wikipedia

Calimero.label: Calimero
Calimero.description: Calimero is an Italian/Japanese cartoon about a charming, but hapless anthropomorphized cartoon chicken; the only black one in a family of yellow chickens. He wears half of his egg shell still on his head. Wikipedia

Digimon Frontier.label: Digimon Digital Monsters - Season 4
Digimon Frontier.description: Digimon Frontier, known outside of Japan as the fourth season of Digimon Digital Monsters, is the fourth television anime series produced by Toei Animation based on the Digimon franchise. Wikipedia

NieA 7.label: NieA_7
NieA 7.description: NieA_7, also known as NieA under 7, is a 13 episode anime series about Mayuko, a poor, introverted student who lives above a Japanese bathhouse, and NieA, a freeloading, freewheeling alien who lives in her closet and eats her food. Wikipedia

Shinzo.label: Shinzo
Shinzo.description: Shinzo, known as Mushrambo in Japan, is an anime produced by Toei Animation and based on the Chinese legend Journey to the West. In the series, creatures known as Enterrans take over Earth and rename it in their own image Enterra. Wikipedia

Last Order: Final Fantasy VII.label: Last Order Final Fantasy VII
Last Order: Final Fantasy VII.description: Last Order Final Fantasy VII, also abbreviated as Last Order or LO, is a 2005 Japanese anime original video animation produced by Madhouse and released by Square Enix. Wikipedia

Taotao (anime).label: Taotao
Taotao (anime).description: Taotao is an anime series aired for 26 episodes on TV Osaka from October 7, 1983 through March 30, 1984. A second series with the same title was aired from October 9, 1984 through April 9, 1985. Wikipedia

Yankee Doodle Daffy.label: Yankee Doodle Daffy
Yankee Doodle Daffy.description: Yankee Doodle Daffy is a Warner Bros. Looney Tunes theatrical cartoon short released in 1943, directed by Friz Freleng and written by Tedd Pierce. The short was the second Technicolor Looney Tunes entry to feature Porky Pig and Daffy Duck. Wikipedia

Mobile Suit Gundam SEED C.E. 73: Stargaz.label: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED C.E. 73 Stargazer
Mobile Suit Gundam SEED C.E. 73: Stargaz.description: Mobile Suit Gundam SEED C.E. 73 Stargazer is a side story to the anime TV series, Mobile Suit Gundam SEED Destiny. As of July 2006, it is being streamed on Bandai Channel as an original net animation. Wikipedia

Plane Crazy.label: Plane Crazy
Plane Crazy.description: Plane Crazy is an American animated short film directed by Walt Disney and Ub Iwerks. The cartoon, released in 1929 by the Walt Disney Studios, was the first creation of the character Mickey Mouse. Wikipedia

Andersen Monogatari (TV series).label: Andersen Monogatari
Andersen Monogatari (TV series).description: Hans Christian Andersen Stories is a Japanese anime series by Mushi Productions and aired on Fuji TV from January 3 to December 21, 1971. Wikipedia

Baby Puss (film).label: Baby Puss
Baby Puss (film).description: Baby Puss is a 1943 one-reel animated cartoon and is the 12th Tom and Jerry short directed by William Hanna and Joseph Barbera and produced by Fred Quimby, Baby Puss was released to theaters on Christmas day, 1943 by Metro-Goldwyn Mayer. Wikipedia

Bottle Fairy.label: Bottle Fairy
Bottle Fairy.description: Bottle Fairy is an anime series about four fairies who discover the secrets of the world from inside their little house. Wikipedia

Fencer of Minerva.label: Fencer of Minerva
Fencer of Minerva.description: Fencer of Minerva is a five episode soft-core hentai anime series released in the U.S. by Central Park Media in two DVD volumes. Wikipedia

Hoshizora Kiseki.label: Hoshizora Kiseki
Hoshizora Kiseki.description: Hoshizora Kiseki is a 27 minute Japanese anime directed by Akio Watanabe and Toshikazu Matsubara, and produced by CoMix Wave Inc. as an original net animation. Wikipedia

Hare-Less Wolf.label: Hare-Less Wolf
Hare-Less Wolf.description: Hare-Less Wolf is a 1958 Merrie Melodies cartoon starring Bugs Bunny and the absent-minded wolf character, Charles M. Wolf. An uncredited June Foray voices the wolf's wife, who appears in a brief scene at the beginning of the cartoon. Wikipedia

Mickey's Birthday Party.label: Mickey's Birthday Party
Mickey's Birthday Party.description: Mickey's Birthday Party is a cartoon made by Walt Disney and distributed by RKO Radio Pictures. It was released on February 7, 1942. Wikipedia

Mother Pluto.label: Mother Pluto
Mother Pluto.description: Mother Pluto is a Silly Symphonies cartoon released on November 14, 1936, directed by David Hand. The cartoon features the adorable pup, Pluto. Wikipedia

Pink Blue Plate.label: Pink Blue Plate
Pink Blue Plate.description: Pink Blue Plate is the 64th cartoon produced in the Pink Panther series. A total of 124 6-minute cartoons were produced between 1964 and 1980. Wikipedia

Project A-ko 2: Plot of the Daitokuji Fi.label: Project A-Ko Love & Robots - Plot of the Daitokuji Financial Group
Project A-ko 2: Plot of the Daitokuji Fi.description: Project A-ko 2 The Plot of the Daitokuji Financial Group is the second Project A-ko movie in the series. Wikipedia

Submarine 707R.label: Submarine 707R
Submarine 707R.description: Submarine 707R is a two-episode anime OVA produced by Group TAC and Sony and also a manga released by Satoru Ozawa released in 1963-1965 on Weekly Shōnen Sunday and although not a mecha robot series, ... Wikipedia

Tee for Two.label: Tee for Two
Tee for Two.description: Tee for Two is a 1945 one-reel animated cartoon and is the 20th Tom and Jerry short. It was produced in Technicolor and released to theatres on July 21, 1945 by Metro-Goldwyn Mayer. The cartoon name is a pun on the phrase "Tea for two". Wikipedia

Yanky Clippers.label: Yanky Clippers
Yanky Clippers.description: Yanky Clippers is a silent animated film starring Oswald the Lucky Rabbit. It is among the few shorts created during the Winkler period known to be existing. The cartoon is also Oswald's last film. Wikipedia

Yomigaeru Sora – Rescue Wings.label: Yomigaeru Sora – Rescue Wings
Yomigaeru Sora – Rescue Wings.description: Yomigaeru Sora - Rescue Wings - is a Japanese anime series produced by J.C. STAFF which aired on TV Tokyo in 2006. Wikipedia

Alice Solves the Puzzle.label: Alice Solves the Puzzle
Alice Solves the Puzzle.description: Alice Solves the Puzzle is a 1925 animated short film by Walt Disney in the Alice Comedies series, and the first to feature Pete. Wikipedia

Avenger (anime).label: Avenger
Avenger (anime).description: Avenger is an anime series, produced by Bandai Visual, Bee Train and Xebec, and directed by Koichi Mashimo. It is set on post-apocalyptic colonized Mars. Wikipedia

Chicken Little (1943 film).label: Chicken Little
Chicken Little (1943 film).description: Chicken Little is a 1943 short film created by Walt Disney during World War II. Unlike the company's 2005 movie of the same name, this short was based on the fable The Sky is Falling itself. Wikipedia

Egyptian Melodies.label: Egyptian Melodies
Egyptian Melodies.description: Egyptian Melodies is a 1931 Silly Symphonies animated short subject produced by Walt Disney and directed by Wilfred Jackson. In the film, a spider wanders down into an Egyptian tomb. Wikipedia

How to Hook Up Your Home Theater.label: How to Hook Up Your Home Theater
How to Hook Up Your Home Theater.description: How to Hook Up Your Home Theater is a 2007 theatrical cartoon from Walt Disney Animation Studios, directed by Kevin Deters and co-directed by Stevie Wermers-Skelton. Wikipedia

Lambert the Sheepish Lion.label: Lambert the Sheepish Lion
Lambert the Sheepish Lion.description:
Lambert the Sheepish Lion is a Disney animated short film that was released in 1952.
The 8-minute film focuses on Lambert, a lion that is mistakenly left with a flock of sheep by a stork. Wikipedia

Le Pig-Al Patrol.label: Le Pig-Al Patrol
Le Pig-Al Patrol.description: Le Pig-Al Patrol is the 16th short in the Inspector series of theatrical cartoons. A total of 34 entries were produced between 1965 and 1969. Wikipedia

No Smoking (1951 film).label: No Smoking
No Smoking (1951 film).description: No Smoking is a cartoon made by Walt Disney Productions in 1951, featuring Goofy. This cartoon is another episode of the "Goofy the Everyman" series of the 1950s. Wikipedia

Roujin Z.label: Roujin Z
Roujin Z.description: Roujin Z is a 1991 Japanese anime film directed by Hiroyuki Kitakubo and written by Katsuhiro Otomo. Wikipedia

Project Blue Earth SOS.label: Project Blue Earth SOS
Project Blue Earth SOS.description: Project Blue Earth SOS is an anime series consisting of six hour-long episodes. It was aired on the Japanese television network, AT-X, from July 2 to December 3, 2006. It was originally licensed by ADV Films for $180,000. Wikipedia

Pigs Is Pigs (1954 film).label: Pigs Is Pigs
Pigs Is Pigs (1954 film).description: Pigs Is Pigs is a 1954 animated film by Walt Disney Studios. Based on the story "Pigs Is Pigs" by Ellis Parker Butler, it relates the tale of a railway agent and his problems with a shipment of two guinea pigs that proceed to breed rapidly. Wikipedia

The Art of Skiing.label: The Art of Skiing
The Art of Skiing.description: The Art of Skiing is a Goofy cartoon made by Walt Disney Productions in 1941. It has historical significance as the first cartoon to use the goofy holler, as well as being the short that led to the "How ... Wikipedia

The Practical Pig.label: The Practical Pig
The Practical Pig.description: The Practical Pig is a Silly Symphonies cartoon. It was released on February 24, 1939, and directed by Dick Rickard. It was the second-to-last Silly Symphony made, and the fourth and final cartoon starring The Three Pigs. Wikipedia

Three Little Wolves (film).label: Three Little Wolves
Three Little Wolves (film).description: Three Little Wolves is a Silly Symphonies cartoon. Released on April 18, 1936, and directed by Dave Hand. It was the third Silly Symphony cartoon starring the Three Little Pigs. Wikipedia

Toot, Whistle, Plunk and Boom.label: Toot, Whistle, Plunk and Boom
Toot, Whistle, Plunk and Boom.description: Toot, Whistle, Plunk and Boom is an educational Adventures in Music animated short film produced by Walt Disney Productions, and originally released to theaters by Buena Vista Distribution on November 10, 1953. Wikipedia
Awards: Academy Award for Best Short Film (Animated)

Wide Open Spaces (1947 film).label: Wide Open Spaces
Wide Open Spaces (1947 film).description: Wide Open Spaces is a 1947 Donald Duck short cartoon, produced by Walt Disney and directed by Jack King for Walt Disney Productions and RKO Radio Pictures. Wikipedia

Working for Peanuts.label: Working for Peanuts
Working for Peanuts.description: Working for Peanuts is a 1953 animated short produced by Walt Disney. It is notable for being one of their first shorts filmed in 3D. The tagline of the film is "Walt Disney's Donald Duck & Chip 'N Dale in their first laugh riot in 3-Dimension." Wikipedia

Balloon Land.label: Balloon Land
Balloon Land.description: Balloon Land, also known as The Pincushion Man, is a 1935 animated short film produced by Ub Iwerks as part of the ComiColor Cartoons series. The cartoon is about a place called Balloon Land, whose residents are made entirely out of balloons. Wikipedia

Carried by the Wind: Tsukikage Ran.label: Carried by the Wind Tsukikage Ran
Carried by the Wind: Tsukikage Ran.description: Carried by the Wind Tsukikage Ran is an animated action comedy written and directed by Akitaro Daichi, and produced by Madhouse Studios. The television series follows Ran and Meow, two wanderers who face all sorts of antagonists in Tokugawa Japan. Wikipedia

Calypso Cat.label: Calypso Cat
Calypso Cat.description: Calypso Cat is a Tom and Jerry cartoon produced in 1961 and released in 1962. It was directed by Gene Deitch and produced by William L. Snyder. It is the 7th of 13 Tom and Jerry cartoons made in the present-day Czech Republic. Wikipedia

Genji Tsūshin Agedama.label: Genji Tsūshin Agedama
Genji Tsūshin Agedama.description: Genji Tsūshin Agedama is a Japanese anime television series produced by Nihon Ad Systems and Studio Gallop. The show itself is a parody of other popular anime of its kind. Wikipedia

I'll CKBC.label: I'll CKBC
I'll CKBC.description: I'll / Crazy Kouzu Basketball Club is an anime OVA based on the manga, I'll, by Hiroyuki Asada. The manga has yet to be released in North America. Wikipedia

Kimagure Robot.label: Kimagure Robot
Kimagure Robot.description: Kimagure Robot is a series of ten 2-minute shorts that were sponsored by Yahoo! as a free promotion for Yahoo! Japan. The episodes were broadcast in 2004 and most shorts were directed by a different Studio 4°C director. Wikipedia

Grampy's Indoor Outing.label: Grampy's Indoor Outing
Grampy's Indoor Outing.description: Grampy's Indoor Outing is a 1936 Fleischer Studio animated short, starring Betty Boop and Grampy. Wikipedia

Mujigen Hunter Fandora.label: Mujigen Hunter Fandora
Mujigen Hunter Fandora.description: Mujigen Hunter Fandora is an original video animation created by manga artist Go Nagai. It was originally released on September 21, 1985, March 10, 1986 and November 21, 1986 by Nippon Columbia Co., Ltd.. Wikipedia

SD Gundam Sangokuden Brave Battle Warrio.label: SD Gundam Sangokuden Brave Battle Warriors
SD Gundam Sangokuden Brave Battle Warrio.description: SD Gundam Sangokuden Brave Battle Warriors is a Japanese anime television adaptation of the SD Gundam model kit series BB Senshi Sangokuden that began airing on April 3, 2010 and is produced by Sunrise. Wikipedia

Lighter Than Hare.label: Lighter Than Hare
Lighter Than Hare.description: "Lighter Than Hare" is a Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies animated short written and directed by Friz Freleng. It was originally released on December 17, 1960. The title is a play on the phrase lighter than air. Wikipedia

Stage Door Cartoon.label: Stage Door Cartoon
Stage Door Cartoon.description: Stage Door Cartoon is a 1944 Warner Bros. cartoon in the Merrie Melodies series, directed by Friz Freleng and featuring Bugs Bunny, Elmer Fudd, and a predecessor to Yosemite Sam. Wikipedia

Tokio Private Police.label: Tokio Private Police
Tokio Private Police.description: Tokio Private Police is an hentai anime series set in the future, and centers around a mecha platoon of a private security firm setting up for action... and one female officer in particular. Wikipedia

The Bowling Alley Cat.label: The Bowling Alley Cat
The Bowling Alley Cat.description: The Bowling Alley Cat is a 1942 one-reel animated cartoon and is the 7th Tom and Jerry short. It was produced in Technicolor and released to theatres on July 18, 1942 by Metro-Goldwyn Mayer and reissued for re-release in 1948. Wikipedia

Venus 5.label: Venus 5
Venus 5.description: Venus 5 is a hentai anime 2-part series about five schoolgirls with supernatural powers who must defend the Earth from the Evil Inma Empire and their leader, Necros. Wikipedia

Whoops! I'm a Cowboy.label: Whoops! I'm a Cowboy
Whoops! I'm a Cowboy.description: Whoops! I'm a Cowboy! is a 1937 Fleischer Studios animated short film starring Betty Boop. Wikipedia

Rurouni Kenshin: Trust & Betrayal.label: Rurouni Kenshin
Rurouni Kenshin: Trust & Betrayal.description: Rurouni Kenshin Trust & Betrayal, known in Japan as Rurouni Kenshin Tsuiokuhen, is an OVA series that serves as a prequel to the Rurouni Kenshin anime television series. Wikipedia

Road Runner a Go-Go.label: Road Runner a Go-Go
Road Runner a Go-Go.description: Road Runner a Go-Go is one of 3 cartoons reused from the unsold pilot Adventures of the Road Runner. Milt Franklyn was credited as the musician with the correct spelling of his name. Wikipedia

Casshan: Robot Hunter.label: Casshan Robot Hunter
Casshan: Robot Hunter.description: Casshan Robot Hunter, known in Japan as Robot Hunter Casshern or simply Casshern, is a 1993 OVA produced by Tatsunoko Productions and animated by Artmic and Gainax. Wikipedia

Macross II.label: The Super Dimension Fortress Macross II Lovers, Again
Macross II.description: Super Dimensional Fortress Macross II Lovers Again was the first instalment in the Macross franchise to feature a new cast of characters. Macross II was produced by Big West, with no involvement from series creators Studio Nue. Wikipedia

Argento Soma.label: Argento Soma
Argento Soma.description:
Argento Soma is a 25-episode anime TV series that aired on TV Tokyo from October 6, 2000, to March 22, 2001.
Episode 26, "Alone and by myself", was released direct-to-video. Wikipedia

Gulliver Boy.label: Gulliver Boy
Gulliver Boy.description: Imagination Science World Gulliver Boy or simply Gulliver Boy is a Japanese anime series created by Hiroi Oji and Toyoo Ashida. Wikipedia

Mutant Turtles: Choujin Densetsu-hen.label: Mutant Turtles Superman Legend
Mutant Turtles: Choujin Densetsu-hen.description: Mutant Turtles Superman Legend is an original video animation based on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles franchise. The OVA was produced by TV Tokyo as a tie-in to the Japanese Ninja Turtles toyline sold by Takara. Wikipedia

Powerpuff Girls Z.label: Powerpuff Girls Z
Powerpuff Girls Z.description: Powerpuff Girls Z, known in some other countries as PPGZ for short, is a magical girl anime series based on the American animated television series The Powerpuff Girls. Wikipedia

Bonanza Bunny.label: Bonanza Bunny
Bonanza Bunny.description: Bonanza Bunny is a 1959 Bugs Bunny cartoon featuring French Canadian claim jumper Blacque Jacque Shellacque. Wikipedia

Bill of Hare.label: Bill of Hare
Bill of Hare.description: Bill Of Hare is a 1962 Bugs Bunny cartoon featuring the Tasmanian Devil. Wikipedia

Early to Bet.label: Early to Bet
Early to Bet.description: Early to Bet is a Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies theatrical cartoon short released on May 12, 1951 starring The Gambling Bug. The Gambling Bug is a small character who infects others with the desire to gamble. Wikipedia

French Rarebit.label: French Rarebit
French Rarebit.description: French Rarebit is a 1951 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies animated short, directed by Robert McKimson and written by Tedd Pierce. The title is a takeoff on "Welsh rarebit", which is also known as "Welsh rabbit". Wikipedia

Hare We Go.label: Hare We Go
Hare We Go.description: Hare We Go is a 1951 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies cartoon starring Bugs Bunny. Wikipedia

Hillbilly Hare.label: Hillbilly Hare
Hillbilly Hare.description: Hillbilly Hare is a 1950 Merrie Melodies cartoon starring Bugs Bunny, produced and released by Warner Bros. Pictures. It was directed by Robert McKimson, with a story by Tedd Pierce and musical direction by Carl Stalling. Wikipedia

Maya the Honey Bee.label: Maya the Bee
Maya the Honey Bee.description: Maya the Bee is an anime television series produced by Zuiyo Enterprise in Japan. The series consisted of 52 episodes and was originally telecast across Japan from April 1975 to April 1976 on the TV Asahi network. Wikipedia

Hot Cross Bunny.label: Hot Cross Bunny
Hot Cross Bunny.description: Hot Cross Bunny is a 1948 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies theatrical animated short, starring Bugs Bunny. The title is a play on the nursery rhyme Hot Cross Buns as well as a punny allusion to the basic plot premise. Wikipedia

Nanami-chan.label: Nanami-chan
Nanami-chan.description: Nanami-chan is an anime series that runs in 5 minute segments. As of February 2009, 76 of Nanami-chan's episodes have been broadcast on NHK since 2004. Wikipedia

Noveltoons.label: Noveltoons
Noveltoons.description: Noveltoons was an anthology series of animated cartoons produced by Paramount Pictures' Famous Studios from 1943 to the close of the studio in 1967. Wikipedia

Rabbit's Kin.label: Rabbit's Kin
Rabbit's Kin.description: Rabbit's Kin is a Merrie Melodies short produced in 1952 and released on November 15, 1952. It was directed by Robert McKimson and written by Tedd Pierce. Wikipedia

Rebel Rabbit.label: Rebel Rabbit
Rebel Rabbit.description: Rebel Rabbit is a 1949 animated short starring Bugs Bunny. It is an anomaly in the Bugs Bunny cartoons — in this one, Bugs is the aggressor, and he ends up losing the fight. Wikipedia

Super Doll Licca-chan.label: Super Doll Licca-chan
Super Doll Licca-chan.description: Super Doll★Licca-chan is an anime TV series which ran on TV Tokyo from 1998–1999. Kodansha also serialized a manga based on the anime series in its monthly manga magazine Nakayoshi. Wikipedia

Let's Sing with Popeye.label: Let's Sing with Popeye
Let's Sing with Popeye.description: Let's Sing With Popeye is a 1934 Screen Songs animated short, produced by Fleischer Studios and directed by Dave Fleischer. It was later re-released by Official Films in the 1950s. Wikipedia

Jerky Turkey.label: Jerky Turkey
Jerky Turkey.description: Jerky Turkey is an animated theatrical short, directed by Tex Avery, released on 7 April 1945 by MGM. Wikipedia

infoboxless: A.D. Police: To Protect and Serve
The Wonderful Wizard of Oz (1986 TV series)
